content: not a necessary step in the pattern but it is recommended border and halter neck straps row 1 at this point you will begin chaining the length that you want for your first neck strap i suggest anywhere from 60 chains upwards but this can alter depending on your body type and preferences for the length of the straps once you have chained the number desired slip_stitch to the top of one side of your front panel chain 1 and half treble_crochet into this same space htc down the front panel side that you are working on along the back and up the other side of the front panel chain the same number you chained at the beginning of the row + 1 as a turning chain turn row 2 htc along chains created and sts previously worked in chain 1 turn row 3-4 repeat row 2 you can continue this along extra row if you want a top with more coverage along the sides and a thicker strap cast off and weave in your ends @hooked graces 6 your devon crop is now complete i hope you enjoyed making the top and will enjoy wearing it if you have any questions please feel free to send me a message on instagram @hooked graces 😊 i would love to see completed garments made with this pattern so please feel free to tag me in any @hooked graces 7 tester appreciation & look book i want to say a huge thank you to all of my testers who i couldn t have published this pattern without your guys feedback + finished garments have helped me to adjust this pattern + make sure that it is suitable for all bodies and style preferences thank you julia @girlypopcrochet c meisha @sleepyfrogstitches c @hooked graces 8 nat @craftedbynatct heidi @hurricanehooks c @hooked graces 9 greta @wranglercrochet c
